isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: TRW/ROSS-TAS 40, 55, 65 AND 85 - ASSEMBLE - VALVE HOUSING/WORM SCREW

step1.para: With the worm vertical, place the valve housing, input shaft, valve/worm assembly in a vise ( Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Valve Housing/Worm Screw in Vise

step1.para: If necessary, unstake the valve housing where it was upset into the adjuster locknut slot. Also unstake adjuster nut from the adjuster ( Figure 98).
Use tool 4402-6 to turn the bearing adjuster locknut out of the valve housing ( Figure 99).
Use tool 4402-2 to turn the bearing adjuster out of the valve housing ( Figure 100).
Remove and discard seal ring and O-ring from the bearing adjuster ( Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Discard Seal Ring and O-Ring

step1.para: Remove the input shaft, valve/worm assembly from the valve housing ( Figure 102).
Remove the thin thrust washer and thrust bearing from the input shaft ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Remove Thrust Washer and Thrust Bearing

step1.para: Remove the thick thrust washer and thrust bearing from the valve housing ( Figure 104).

note.para: Input shaft, valve worm assembly must not be disassembled further. The components were a select fit at assembly and are available only as part of this subassembly. If disassembled further, the subassembly must be replaced.

step1.para: For alternate construction TAS65 gears, remove the spacer sleeve, thin washer, thrust bearing and thick washer ( Figure 105).

figure.caption: Figure 105. Remove Spacer, Washer, Bearing and Thick Washer

important.para: If the TAS65 gear has a ball bearing and ball race in the valve housing, remove them and call TRW for disposition. Do not rebuild the gear.

step1.para: Remove and discard the seal rings and O-rings from the valve housing ( Figure 106).

figure.caption: Figure 106. Discard Seal Rings and O-Ring

step1.para: Turn over the valve housing and remove the retaining ring ( Figure 107).

caution.para: Exercise special care when removing the input shaft seal to prevent damaging the valve housing seal bore.

step1.para: Tap input shaft seal out of the valve housing. Discard the seal ( Figure 108).

note.para: The valve housing also uses a ball plug for manufacturing purposes that must not be removed.

step1.para: Inspect the sealing areas of the input shaft and valve for nicks and run your fingernail edge across the sealing surfaces to detect steps. Inspect for discoloration from excess heat. Inspect the input shaft ball-track grooves for brinelling or spalling. If any of these conditions exist, you must replace the input shaft, valve/worm assembly, valve housing and balls. Also replace the rack piston if brinelling or spalling is found ( Figure 109).
Inspect the thrust bearing rollers for any deterioration. Inspect thrust washers for brinelling, spalling, or cracks. Replace any part with these conditions ( Figure 110).
Alternate Construction TAS65: If spacer sleeve is damaged, replace the input shaft/valve/worm subassembly and use thick washer and roller bearing only during reassembly ( Figure 110).
Place valve housing firmly in a vise so the input shaft, valve/worm assembly can be assembled vertically with the worm end up ( Figure 111).

caution.para: Do not clamp against threaded port hole or relief valve hole sealing faces when placing valve housing in vise.

step1.para: Oil and assemble a new O-ring into its counterbore in valve housing ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 112. Oil and Assemble New O-Ring

step1.para: Lightly oil and assemble new O-ring and new seal ring into the large diameter seal ring groove in valve housing, bending and working them in and smoothing them out as necessary ( Figure 113).

figure.caption: Figure 113. Work New O-Ring and Seal Ring In

step1.para: Install roller thrust bearing and then the thick washer (square side out) onto the input shaft end of the input shaft, valve, worm subassembly, seating them against the input shaft thrust face ( Figure 114).

Alternate construction TAS65: Assemble spacer sleeve onto input shaft with radiused side toward the valve. Make sure sleeve is square. Assemble thin washer, thrust bearing, and thick washer onto input shaft behind the spacer sleeve ( Figure 115).

important.para: If you are replacing the input shaft valve/worm assembly, discard spacer sleeve and thin washer.

step1.para: Lightly oil and assemble new seal ring onto input shaft and against the thick thrust washer to hold the bearing components in place ( Figure 116).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Oil and Assemble New Seal Ring

step1.para: Dip the input end of the input shaft, valve, worm assembly into oil up to the worm lead. Assemble the input shaft end of the assembly into the valve housing until it is firmly seated ( Figure 117).

Apply oil and assemble the other thrust bearing then the thin thrust washer over the ball groove end of the worm and seat them against the shoulder of the input shaft, valve, worm assembly ( Figure 118).

figure.caption: Figure 118. Apply Oil and Assemble Thrust Bearing

step1.para: Lightly oil a new O-ring and assemble into the seal groove in the bearing adjuster. Oil and work a new seal ring into the same groove and smooth it out ( Figure 119).

figure.caption: Figure 119. Oil New O-Ring and Assemble

note.para: Be sure the valve housing, adjuster locknut and bearing adjuster threads are clean and free of any staking burrs that would impede the locknut from turning freely on the adjuster or the adjuster turning freely in the valve housing.

step1.para: Lightly oil and assemble bearing adjuster over the worm and into the valve housing. Tighten adjuster to 13 ft-lbs. (18 N•m) using a torque wrench inserted in the adjuster tool 4402-2. This will seat the components. Back off adjuster 1/4 to 1/2 of a turn ( Figure 120).

figure.caption: Figure 120. Oil and Assemble Bearing Adjuster

step1.para: Lightly oil and assemble new locknut onto bearing adjuster with radius (slightly rounded) side down ( Figure 121). Use tool 4402-6 to tighten slightly to keep the bearing adjuster in place.

figure.caption: Figure 121. Oil and Assemble New Lockout

step1.para: Reverse assembly in vise so the worm end is down. With an inch pound torque wrench on the input shaft, note torque required to rotate the input shaft 360° in each direction. Tighten the bearing adjuster to increase the maximum torque at the input shaft 5 to 10 in-lbs. (0.5 to 1.0 N•m) over that which was previously noted ( Figure 122).

Again reverse the assembly in vise. Tighten locknut while holding bearing adjuster in position established in step 24 with appropriate adjuster tool. When using a torque wrench in locknut tool 4402-6, the torque wrench reading should be 112 ft-lbs. (152 N•m) ( Figure 123).

note.para: The bearing adjuster, locknut and valve housing flange should be flush. If not, the seal ring or O-ring may be out of position, which will result in axial lash.

step1.para: Reverse assembly in vise and re-check input shaft torque. It should match torque measured in step 24. Repeat steps 24 and 25 if necessary ( Figure 124).

Stake valve housing into the clockwise most corner of two opposing slots in locknut. Stake the locknut into the adjuster in two places (180° apart) at threaded area. Choose areas that have not been previously staked ( Figure 125).

figure.caption: Figure 125. Stake Valve Housing and Locknut

step1.para: After staking, torque required to rotate input shaft must be between 5 to 10 in-lbs. (0.5 to 1.0 N•m) greater than the torque noted in step 24. Torque value must not exceed 22 in-lbs. (2.5 N•m). Unstake and re-adjust if necessary.
Reposition worm screw/valve housing subassembly in soft-jawed vise, clamping tightly against the valve housing, so the worm screw is pointing down ( Figure 126).

Apply clean grease to the outside and inside diameters (fill cavity between the lips) of the new input shaft seal and assemble it, garter spring side first over the input shaft. Align the seal in the valve housing seal bore.

Assemble seal installer tool 4402-4, small diameter end first, over the input shaft and against the seal. Tap the seal installer tool until the tool shoulder is squarely against the valve housing. This will correctly position the seal in the housing bore just beyond the retaining ring groove ( Figure 127).

figure.caption: Figure 127. Correctly Position Seal in Housing Bore

step1.para: Remove any seal material that may have sheared off and is in seal bore and retaining ring groove.

important.para: The input shaft seal must be square in the seal bore and installed to the correct depth.

step1.para: Insert new retaining ring into its groove in the valve housing ( Figure 128).
After the gear is completely assembled, perform FINAL ADJUSTMENT.
